text:
Created attachment 34811
An improved view of the table with grouped column headers

I found it quite confusing to read the table of the top 5 errors by sampler when there are various types of errors occuring in the test.

I have suggested a slightly modified example of the table in the attachment. I hope these changes will make the table easier to digest and follow.

The idea is group the name of the error in the column headers and just have the #Errors below that, instead of duplicating the errors each time. This will free up space in the table and make it clearer I think.

Thank you for JMeter!

---

Additionally I opened a ticket regarding a bug in the table...
https://bz.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=60840

text:
Why wont you change it? What is your rational?

Look at the "Statistics" table above. The totals row (first row) are totals of the columns below them. In the table "Top 5 Errors by sampler" this is obviously not the case. It is not consistent with the other tables. This is confusing dont you think?

Totals are meant to summarise the columns below them if located directly above them.
